title: Designing for preschool audience?
content:
I received the following from a friend. I’ll admit I don’t have a clue; anybody know where they can look? — Thanks, Charles any idea where I might find comp specs or typography standards
for early learning reading? Surely they must have some guidelines
somewhere on x-height, leading, line length, recommended fonts? I’m doing some volunteer work — don’t even ask — [‹ Corporate Ipsum](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202084958/http:/typophile.com/node/32499 "Go to previous forum topic") [FF Blur and other contemporary fonts. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202084958/http:/typophile.com/node/32398 "Go to next forum topic")
author: charles_e

comments.content: Charles, this doesn’t quite answer the specs and standards question directly, but the person who I think did the best work in this area is Dr. Rosemary Sassoon – after whom the Sassoon typeface on the ITC article page is named. Find out more about the work she has done with Adrian Williams and Club Type [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202084958/http:/www.clubtype.co.uk/sassjoiner.html)
